Description: Vertical handle sherd of East Greek painted grey ware pottery vessel, possibly a krater or bowl; plastic decoration, resembling a large rivet on inside below rounded rim; traces of red around 'rivet'; light grey fabric and very worn dark slip, not apparent on inside around the 'rivet'.
Curator's comments: An enigmatic piece; possibly from a trefoil oenochoe, since the rim fragment is concave at the join with the handle; but the inside should have been slipped if an oenochoe.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.076)
